message_1:
A company called XYZ produces two types of products: Product A and Product B. The production of Product A requires 2 hours of labor and 1 hour of machine time, while the production of Product B requires 3 hours of labor and 1 hour of machine time. The company has 50 hours of labor and 24 hours of machine time available per day. The profit for each unit of Product A is $10 and for each unit of Product B is $12. The company wants to maximize their daily profit.

Write the mixed-integer programming problem that will help the company determine the optimal number of units of Product A and Product B to produce per day, given the available labor and machine time.
message_2:
Let x be the number of units of Product A produced per day and y be the number of units of Product B produced per day.

Objective function (to maximize daily profit):
Maximize P = 10x + 12y

Constraints (based on available labor and machine time):
2x + 3y ≤ 50 (labor constraint)
x + y ≤ 24 (machine time constraint)
x ≥ 0, y ≥ 0 (non-negativity constraint)

The mixed-integer programming problem can be written as:

Maximize P = 10x + 12y
subject to
2x + 3y ≤ 50
x + y ≤ 24
x, y ≥ 0 and integer values
